TopicTitle: The Stock Craft Repository (v0.24.2) - no longer being maintained

Articles.Content:
[Click here to view the old stock craft repository.]

Note: this repository is no longer being maintained, since I've been struggling to find time to update it, and frankly, we need a new repository for 0.25 (most crafts from previous versions are incompatible).

In this thread you will find a repository of all sorts of different stock crafts created by different people. To have your craft added here, make a post with a picture of your craft, a brief description (plus if it's for the VAB or SPH), and a download link.

Some good free uploading sites that will allow you to upload files are Google Drive, Dropbox, or MediaFire. If you don't want to make an account with a file sharing site, then use Wikisend to allow you to share your file for up to 90 days before it is deleted. Be sure to click "Properties" before you upload and set the lifetime to 90 days, or it will default to 7.

For image hosting, Imgur works best with the KSP forums and allows you to create albums which you can embed in your posts. If you don't want to create an account, use PostImage. It will host your images forever.

There are two rules for submitting crafts:

  • They must be compatible with the latest version of KSP (version 0.24.2). Please open your .craft file in the newest version to ensure it is compatible. However, anything from 0.22 and higher should pretty much be compatible.
  • They must be stock! You can use MechJeb/Engineer to build your craft, but please take off those parts when you submit your file so anyone can open them in stock KSP.

In case you're wondering, the link on the craft's file name will bring you directly to the download link, and the link on the creator's name will bring you to their post (where applicable). Clicking the "Spoiler" button will show albums, images, and/or videos for each craft.

Have fun sharing your creations! If you see one you like, go ahead and give its creator some Reputation! And if you appreciate the work I do in maintaining this repository, feel free to give me some Reputation as well, by clicking the star-like button on the lower-left corner of this post.

Vehicle Assembly Building

Rockets with Payloads - Rockets that deliver stuff to low (or high) orbits around Kerbin. Not to be confused with subassemblies

  • General Lifters by Rune (see post for downloads) - A group of pre-built lifters (not subassemblies) that can carry 5 to 100 tons to LKO. These are created with realism in mind, and feature fancy fairings to protect the payloads, as well as no crossfeeding between fuel tanks.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
Shotput Courier by GoSlash27 - A rocket capable of delivering a 5-ton payload to an 80x80km orbit.
Fuel Tanker by jBeta - A tanker that can take 20,000 units of fuel to low Kerbin orbit, with all kinds of docking ports.
Space Station with 12 Ion Explorers by mpk10 - Designed for completing contracts without relaunching from Kerbin, the 12 ion explorers all have docking ports, science, and parachutes.

Payloads by Themselves - Some payloads lack lifters, and those go here.

  • Project Orion by Dieguscus - An analogue of NASA's Orion MPCV, an upper stage to take astronauts into orbit.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
Para-Sci High-Precision Space Tugs by parameciumkid - Three well-balanced space tugs for moving modules around in space.
Purple Wolverine by Vindelle_Sunveam - A probe that can lithobrake on Eve with xenon containers and do science.

Orbital Stations - These may or may not include lifters.

  • OPSEK by iDan122 (see post for downloads) - A Russian-style station assembled from 5+ modules. Each module includes a lifter that can put it in orbit around the Mun, Minmus, and perhaps Duna.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
KHS Station Core and Launcher by Zedwardson - A ten-ton space station core plus a lifter with ~8500 dV.
ODP-1 "Thor" by ScriptKitt3h - A giant orbital weapons platform containing 64 kinetic kill-rods and room for 16 Kerbals.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
Science Processing Station Mk1 by Hades514 - A space station core with a lab, habitation modules, and science.
Sangudo City by Jolly_Roger - A massive space city that can house around 400 Kerbals!

Mun/Minmus Crafts - Crafts that can orbit around or land on one of Kerbin's moons.

  • Space Launch System Block II by Nephf - An Apollo-style Munar rocket, faithful to the real Apollo rockets.
Munar Gravimapper by Vindelle_Sunveam - A probe + launcher that can "scan the gravity fields" of Kerbin's moons.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
Eagle MkIII by Rune - A replica of the Eagle from Space: 1999. After being launched into LKO, it can carry 20 tonnes to the Munar surface and return to LKO. Includes scout rover as a base payload. Best downloaded with the Eagle Base Pack (see below).

Bases - Base modules and base packs, with or without rockets, go here.

  • Eagle Base Pack by Rune - A whole base fit into a single rocket, and it even includes fairings! Use the Eagle MkIII (see above) to land each module, refueling it in low munar orbit.

Interplanetary Crafts - Crafts designed to go to other planets, but not necessarily return.

  • Kassandra by H2O. - A low part count, interplanetary ship with more than enough fuel to go to Duna and back (and many other places). Includes rover, as well as tons of science equipment.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
Fox by jamgoth - A gigantic rocket that can go to different planets. No info was given in its description.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
Unnamed Humongous Rocket by KandoKris - This monster of a rocket is designed to rescue Kerbals lost in space.
Frigate-2 by Jolly_Roger - A craft with a design that is "a cross between a nuclear submarine and a Nebulon-B frigate."

Other - Crafts that don't fit the above categories.

  • Delta Klipper VTOL SSTO by iDan122 (or v2) - A VTOL SSTO that takes off and lands on its tail. It comes in two variants - a fuel tanker or crew delivery vehicle.
Javascript is disabled. View full album
SSTO 08 by bre_czko - A cute, tiny VTOL SSTO that can carry a small science payload to orbit.
Tylo Rover 5.0 by GoSlash27 - A transport rover with engines and docking ports on it to help transport payloads over extreme terrain. It's an SSTO too!
MU Corona-Class Starfighter by ScriptKitt3h - A mid-range assault fighter loaded with missiles (+3 guided ones).
Javascript is disabled. View full album

Spaceplane Hangar

Kerbin SSTOs - A plane which uses a combination of jets and rockets (or RAPIERs) to reach orbit around Kerbin, but not beyond.

  • Falcon 87 by Andrew Hansen - A RAPIER-powered craft that can drive, hover, and even fly to orbit.
Falcon by RocketscientistV - A simple, RAPIER-powered SSTO with docking capabilities. Has wide delta-V margins.

Advanced SSTOs - A plane which uses a combination of jets and rockets (or RAPIERs) to go to one of Kerbin's moons or beyond.

  • Tylo SSTO by Andrew Hansen - A Tylo return-capable spaceplane with a detachable Tylo lander.
VTOL Duna SSTO by Andrew Hansen - A VTOL SSTO Duna return-capable plane.

Space Shuttles - Planes which use rockets to help them fly into orbit (or beyond).

Atmospheric Vehicles - Airplanes that can't leave the atmosphere.

Subassemblies

Lifters - The stages of a rocket designed to lift payloads into space.

  • Pop 3 Modular Lifter System by 9t3ndo (see post for downloads) - A bunch of low part count, nice-looking lifters.
Transvaal 1C by Zedwardson - A lifter that can carry 10 tons to LKO plus 4,000 dV left once in orbit.
Olifant by Zedwardson - A low part-count 1.25m lifter that can carry small payloads to LKO or beyond.
Verkenning by Zedwardson - A crazy lifter made entirely out of solid rocket boosters - three of them!
Lopac Lifter Family by mhoram - A super low part count family of lifters that can carry up to 520 tons to LKO!
Delta IV Heavy by Darth Lazarus - A look-alike to the real Delta IV Heavy lifter. Carries 23 tons to LKO.

Edited October 29, 2014 by Andrew Hansen

To get everyone started, here's a rover for the SPH that I call the Invincib-13 (because Invincible sounds too simple). It's a super robust rover with three variants - the Tough Edition, Luxury Edition, and Science Edition. The Tough and Science versions are able to upright themselves with reaction wheels if they flip over, while the Luxury edition uses a more fragile solar panel to help it flip over. The solar panel works well, but quicksave before flipping over in case you break it off.

Nuff said, though. Here's a video:

Download here.

Hello everybody!

I build this interplanetary ship a few months ago, and I decided it is worth sharing.

I build it with only one thing in mind: fun.

To be more precise:

  • Low part count (because lag is not fun)
  • Easy-going lifter and nice staging events (because the part between the ground and the parking orbit is the most fun in my opinion)
  • High quantity of delta-v (but not too much, since too easy is not fun), most celestial bodies accessible
  • Good control capabilities (because difficulty should lie in the mission, not in the way your spacecraft rotate)
  • Esthetic (well, you are going to look at the ship for a few hours so...)

The machine is composed of a command module, a ion ring, a lander, a rover and a 3-stage lifter. The amount of delta-v is very high, due to the use of ion engines for the return trip.

I am particularly proud of my lander, as it contains everything needed for a good planetary exploration (including a 2-seat rover and all sciences parts) but remain very compact.

The dropbox link contains the craft, every parts of the vessel in subassemblies and a manual (that contains flying instructions and actions groups informations).

I hope you will enjoy flying it as much as I enjoyed building it!

dropbox link and thread

Edited April 20, 2014 by H2O.

Introducing the Mega Mover Mk.I

It's probably a bit overengineered, but the lag isn't too bad for me. What does it do? It moves things. It has a maximum capacity of 38 Kerbals. You can modify it a bit and it'll carry a full orange tank or 2 to the island runway. It has circumnavigation capabilities. It has auxiliary fuel tanks in the front. Its action groups are: 1: Toggle Forward Engines; 2: Toggle Central Engines; 3: Toggle Rear Engines; 4: Toggle ladders. It can land anywhere, but make sure you have a ramp/cliff to get yourself off the ground. It can take a hard landing better than most aircraft I've seen. It's not the best as far as aesthetics go, but it'll get the job done. Forward air intakes are my Improved Aesthetics Dual Intakes. Cruising altitude is 20km.

Engine configs: All 12: Emegency power and takeoff; 8: Cruising; 4: Extreme efficiency and landing.

Warnings: Do not overestimate the landing gear. Landing at more than 10 m/s vertical velocity is not a good idea.

Only the auxillery tanks in the front and the big tank should have fuel in them. Any other configuration messes with the center of mass/lift interaction.

Remember to retract the gear before time acceleration on the ground. They can sometimes sink through.

Do not bother taxiing/turning on the ground. It's not designed for agility.

Do not fly above 25km.

Do not fly like an idiot.

Do not try to land on K2. It's a very bad idea in any plane.

http://wikisend.com/download/934306/Mega Mover Mk_I (the link may not look like it works, but it does)

Edited April 28, 2014 by Andrew Hansen

Alright! Been toying with planes for a week or two now. I decided to make long-range planes, but they turned out to no go very far. So then I decided to fly out fuel planes to multiple destinations. I've never been good at making larger and heavier planes, but I've finally done it!

Here is the "Enabler FT"

Action group 1 activate the forward vertical thrusters and the group 2 toggles the back landing wheels so the craft can pivot up for very short runway takeoffs. (Crucial when you're traversing rough terrain) I use KAS for the fuel transfer (I know this is a stock thread, but it isn't a game changer for the craft) The craft files are vanilla, no mods.

So, that was pretty cool right? I ask myself shortly after I had used it for a real flight and fuel transfer for my south pole missions, could I make it bigger? Better? More Awesome?!?!? The answer was yes!

I give you, *drumroll*

the "Oasis SFT"

It uses the same principles as it's predecessor, and actually more efficiently if I say so myself. It's been tested and proven. Capable of cruising at 7-10 km at half throttle to save fuel, short landings and takeoffs, and a seriously large fuel payload.

Here it is on it's maiden voyage to KSC 2, with fuel remainder shown.

Here are the .craft files

"Enabler FT" https://www.dropbox.com/s/jizuotitfq9lpj1/Tanker%20Plane%20V.craft

"Oasis SFT" https://www.dropbox.com/s/4n5c4hp5zolbap3/Super%20Tanker%20Plane%20V.craft

When KSP enables multiplayer, I am already planning on making mid-flight refueling versions of these with the help of KAS (and a VERY brave kerbal lol) I hope you enjoy!

~~~Some Variations~~~

Hello all, I am going to be brave enough to share my launchers and craft. I generally go with low part, all stock designs and saw this thread and decided to share. I try to keep my rockets close to what real rockets look like for the most part. Please let me know if there is a issue with the shared files, as I am sharing with google drive for the first time. My rockets generally have a Africaans or Esperanto name.

KHS Station Core and Launcher (Kerbal Hejmo en la Spaco)

File here

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxCKBNvHWJfaTUQ3cXV5QlgwS0U/edit?usp=sharing

This is a simple ~ten ton station core with attached launcher. The attached launcher can place the core into a 100km 0 inclination orbit with just over 4000 Dv left to move it to another location. The Station and launcher is under 90 parts. The core itself has a copula, Hitchhiker pod, 100 units of thruster fuel, the 6 way docking port, and batteries and solar cells to power the whole thing.

Here is the station at 125k above with a science module (let me know if anyone wants that), as you can see this one launched with the wrong thrusters, but that has been rectified in the upload.

Now some lifters for your use.

Transvaal 1C

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxCKBNvHWJfacVF2dTE4X3dlVTA/edit?usp=sharing

This is my heavy lifter in my Afrikaans series of launchers. (I have one bigger one on the drawing board, but not built it) As stated previously, it can launch 10 tons into LKO with 4000 Dv left in the upper stage. Combined with the payload that can also include engines, this opens up the entire system for exploration. Payload can be easily increased by increasing the number of Vald boosters as the current design only has three. Currently in my game this is being used for testing, launching parts for my space station, and prepping for a eventual Kerbaled Mun shot.

Veld Launcher

The design for the Veld Launcher was simple, the local design team designed a 30 ton spacecraft that included a 3 man capsule, a hitchhiker module, a docking port, and a sizable engine/fuel combo. This was to be used as a general taxi and all purpose orbital craft, with the option of using it as a core for future manned missions. Thus the Veld was put to paper and to the launch pad to put it in orbit with its own stage only to be used for final adjustment in LKO. The Veld vehicle itself has 2000 Dv by itself, so this allows a wide range of mission options. (Let me know if anyone wants the Veld Vehicle) For ideal launches, you must down thrust your main engine in the lower atmosphere so you don't waste fuel as the 4 boosters will normally make it hit terminal velocity at times. And it a fun launch (unlike the Transvaal 1C)

Olifant

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxCKBNvHWJfaTzM0clczSTZYbzQ/edit?usp=sharing

The Olifant launcher is a all Liquid fueled rocket that is useful to both put complex single kerbal capsules in space, but also for probe landings at sites like the Mun. It is a very easy flyer due to its all liquid fuel design and for manual flight I can very accurately place payloads in the correct orbit. It is a very simple design with few parts.

I will skip over the Ratel and the Korperal, two simple designs for early Karbal flight and small probes and are almost small versions of the Delta II launcher, and instead go to something a little more fun.

Verkenning

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxCKBNvHWJfaZURCZjlhMUVFMDA/edit?usp=sharing

One of the early Nasa Launchers for small probes was called the Scout. It consisted of picking off the shelf solid rocket boosters. I took the concept to KSP and developed the Verkenning (scout in Afrikaans) and it consists of a simple stack of the three main solid rocket boosters. It is a blast to fire it with small payloads. Where else can you in seconds launch a .5 ton probe 1.6 million K above Kerbal in a suborbital launch like I did in one of the tests? For more useful payloads it might be best to have a liquid stage to help with getting the orbits more regular. However it very useful (and fun) to use this booster to quickly launch probes into retrograde, high Molniya orbits, and the like.

I hope you enjoy a few of these.
Woah! Lots of good designs. I've been sort of busy recently, but I'll fill them in now.

Sorry for the double post (I had to do this for notification purposes), but I have a question for Zedwardson.

Are your "lifters" all subassemblies? I have a feeling they're not (or maybe just one is), since they include capsules and stuff. If they aren't subassemblies, I will re-locate them.

I found myself wanting more lighting at the launchpad, although I got totally sidetracked from what I originally was working on. I came up with 6 tiny rovers to illuminate my creations for the occasional night launch, or so the rocket can just sit there and look cool all night. Bob approves.

EDIT: I just realized they don't last all night. I didn't count the OKTO2 probe when I calculated energy usage. Swap the Z-400 for the Z-1k and You'll be good to go.

Recently captured and began construction on Life-Saver Station, an orbital facility built on a class B that would have impacted Kerbin. On the bottom is the Autonomous Asteroid Catcher Mk 1. The habitation unit and command unit (on top) is crewed by 3 kerbals.
